page.title: 08LOBSTER FISHING, CARNOUSTIE
page.content: {Lobster fishing}is carried on at the small village of{Easthaven.} Frank Dunbar is now a full-time lobster and {crab}fisherman, having fished in his spare time for 30yrs. Mr.Dunbar spends about 6hrs. a day tending his creels, taking in the full ones and putting down the freshly-baited ones. Frank uses 90 creels and these have to be repaired from time to time. He also makes his own creels which he does mainly in the winter months. It is very hard work pulling up the creels and he hopes to buy a larger boat soon, which will pull them up by machine. Once a week the{lobsters}and{crabs are taken to{Jonshaven,}a village north of{Montrose,}by lorry. Then they are taken to{Aberdeen}from where they are flown abroad.
